website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive option for a propane tank gauge, but it's still made of sturdy brass materials.
pros: Provides a high level of safety against potential leaks in the propane tank
Works with the most common type of tank connector
Colors that indicate the fill level for the tank are easy to read from a distance
cons: Gauge readings aren't as consistently accurate as some other models

customer_reviews.title: It's been a lifesaver for my rv propane tanks makes ...
customer_reviews.text: It's been a lifesaver for my rv propane tanks makes life much easier when I know how full they are and I know when it's time to refill the tanks instead of running out of propane. EDIT: One of them died adlfter about 7 months or so showing only half a tank when the tank was actually full. The second one was having issues with the cold and freezing according to the maintenance personnel but it always worked fine for me. Still a great thing to have especially for being as inexpensive as it is.
customer_reviews.author: sean briggs

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I always had a tough time telling what kind of charge the tank had on my gas grill, but this thing went on easy and now gives me an idea of what i have left. No running out during a barbecue, unless im not paying attention(there's no gauge for this problem...).
customer_reviews.author: Joel R

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my grill
customer_reviews.text: My gas grill does not include an indicator for my propane tank. I hate it when I am about to grill only to find out I have to refill my propane tank because it is empty. This is definitely a great addition to my Char-Broil 2 burner grill.
customer_reviews.author: Janusse L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Adapter
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to monitor the gas for the grill now instead of running out and not being able to finish cooking. Easily attaches and easy to turn on and shut off! I'd buy it again if needed!
customer_reviews.author: Redkiss

customer_reviews.title: Works great for RV LP tank.
customer_reviews.text: This gauge works great on my RV LP tank unlike other ones i tried that read the tank fine but had a stop valve and wouldn't work on RV's. We now have peace of mind to know when we need a refill instead of always guessing and wasting money on half full tanks that cost the same to refill as empty ones in our area.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: No need to calculate propane tank by weight
customer_reviews.text: I know that the best way to get an accurate reading of the propane level in a 20 pound propane tank is just to weigh it (Full - 37 pounds, empty - 20 pounds) but this gauge is a lot easier as there is no need to disconnect the tank to weigh it. The only downside that I see is that the propane must be flowing to get the gauge to give a reading. Not a big deal. Just turn on the grill like usual and it will give a reading right away.
customer_reviews.author: Dorkydavid

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS!
customer_reviews.text: The part of the gauge that connects to the propane tank, leaks. We kept smelling propane while using the new grill, but all of the burners were functioning properly. We're lucky the escaping propane from this gauge didn't ignite or we'd have had a serious problem. Sending this back for a refund immediately!!
customer_reviews.author: RadMan

customer_reviews.title: Lost all my gas
customer_reviews.text: Everything leaked out the first night. I had tightened the crap out of it and I guess it still leaked out. As I research it more it seems those type of gauges are unreliable and in large part do not work. A scale under the tank is the only true way to measure the contents.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick R.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: I never know how much gas is left in the propane tanks and the last thing I want to do is run out in the middle of canning something. This is a great tool to determine when its time to switch the tank. It isnt an exact measure but it gives you a general idea of whether there is enough left for the task at hand.
customer_reviews.author: sarahsbones

customer_reviews.title: Defective Part
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 adapter's for tanks on 2017 camper right before winter. I tried lighting heater and after tech had to come to my house. I found out that the orifice is too small and heater would not light. cost me $100.00 to get repaired. Good Luck ..
customer_reviews.author: Andre P.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: When the propane is off, it says "Full", when it is running, it varies between almost full and almost empty. I just haven't bothered to try and return it.
customer_reviews.author: D in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice
customer_reviews.text: It turned out I couldnt fit this under my camper im holding on to it for when I hook up my Gas Fire Place
customer_reviews.author: C. Sharpe

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of guessing when it tank was almost empty, so I bought one of these gauges and it seems to work just great so far.
customer_reviews.author: jerwhou38

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Was Looking For
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it is intended to do. It's seems to fairly accurate and is 10 times more accurate than what I used to do (Just lift the tank and guesstimate how much might be left). I think this is a must have if you use any propane tanks frequently that way you know when you're getting low and need a refill or another tank.
customer_reviews.author: Nickd

customer_reviews.title: Not accurately indicated.
customer_reviews.text: The device is easy to install, however, the gas level indicator isn't work properly. Disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: does what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: Tired of running out of propane for the grill unexpectedly. Easy to insert between the tank and the hose. Dial is easy to read. I've had it for this season and it is performing well so far. Seems high quality.
customer_reviews.author: fineshmecker

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate Useless
customer_reviews.text: Gauge went from half full to empty mid stream while BBQing. Obviously it hangs up, rendering it useless!
customer_reviews.author: RJT

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read propane tank gauge
customer_reviews.text: Allows for easy installation. Seals tightly without leakage. Much better fuel gauge than lifting tank to feel how heavy or light the remaining fuel is. Large dial is easy to read. In time, I’ll know how accurate it is.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dunk

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing flashy, but super easy to install and does the trick. It’s nice to know how much LP gas we have in the camper without having to lift the tank and give it a shake.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Buy another  Product this one does not read accurately
customer_reviews.text: I like that it showed up in a timely fashion and I diss like that they did not work only when the temperature is at a high degrees this thing Won’t read anything below 42° it will not read properly you will be better off lifting the tank and checking it the old-school way then to waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Propane won't flow through it.
customer_reviews.text: it is a good gauge for spot checking propane level but propane will not flow through it. (Yes, I took the cap off). I spot check then need to disconnect it to actually use the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT Fit Older Tanks
customer_reviews.text: I could not tell that it did not fit older propane tanks so it is useless to me and I will be inquiring about a refund immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Clark

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy?
customer_reviews.text: So I had 2 new full tanks. It showed them about 1/2 to 3/4 full. So, yes, it will tell you when there is fuel, but as too how much? THAT I question
customer_reviews.author: WinU

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much junk
customer_reviews.text: After 4 months of very little use it no longer allows gas to get to my grill. Shows empty but the tank is full. BBQ works great without it.
customer_reviews.author: cside

customer_reviews.title: Solid built
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to know how much fuel left in the tank, better quality than I expect, fit my 20lb tank without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Nix

customer_reviews.title: Know your gas level.
customer_reviews.text: This lets you know your gas level , the gas in the tank is never a question anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Oldsparkey

customer_reviews.title: Never wonder again
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to any propane device. Won't leave you guessing if you have enough propane to get through the weekend. Easily readable and tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with a Weber Spirit  BBQ
customer_reviews.text: I am not giving it any stars..I have ordered two and had to return both of them because they don't work. Maybe my propane tank 17 lbs the psi is much for it....I don't know
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read
customer_reviews.text: On time. Good price. Needed it for 30 lb propane tank connected to my generator so I know when to switch to gas or change the tank.
customer_reviews.author: cwaits

customer_reviews.title: Gaugeless
customer_reviews.text: Our camper's propane tanks had no gauges and we didn't want to run out mid getaway. Doesn't fit well under the tank cover. Now I know when the tanks are nearing a refill.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne C.

customer_reviews.title: No more guess work
customer_reviews.text: This may not be the fanciest gauge out there. But for the price, it does what I need it to do. It tells me I have fuel. or not. I installed it with ease.
customer_reviews.author: 😊

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased a brand new tank of propane. It is interfering with the gas flow. I'm taking it off.
customer_reviews.author: GrandPa  G

customer_reviews.title: All you need to do is check the quantity of propane so you don't run out while cooking.
customer_reviews.text: It works great so you don't run out of propane in the middle of cooking your favorite foods on the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Allen W. Bauck

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate at all
customer_reviews.text: Says I still have half a tank of propane when it is empty
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Emergency Backup Generator - Fuel Status
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what a guy needs to know his fuel state - especially when I am using LP for my emergency backup generator. I also use it for BBQ - but I wouldn't call that application critical.
customer_reviews.author: Schultzie

customer_reviews.title: Got here quickly easy to install work right away
customer_reviews.text: Great for a quick fix good for family members that use a lot of propane and always guessing For the money it’s OK Durability and lifespan it is questionable
customer_reviews.author: Andy Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Gauge is not accurate.  effectively USELESS
customer_reviews.text: Even on a just filled propane cylinder, this gauge reads very low, making me think I have far less propane than I actually do (after a few cooks, I thought I was low, because the gauge was into the yellow range, took the tank to be filled, only took 1.2 gallons to fill, meaning it was only down about 25%). The photo with this post is on a JUST FILLED propane cylinder..... (and by filled I mean, filled until the safety shutoff tripped and would not allow the tank to be filled any further)
customer_reviews.author: MyTechGuyRI

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Handy gas gauge. Works as advertised. Numbers/gauge could be a little bigger / easier to read.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Ernst

customer_reviews.title: Gage it!
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. The gauge is Not calibrated so the tank is either full getting near empty or empty. Better than the weight scale on grill.
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gauge for my grill, it is nice to know how much gas left in my tank. It has worked well so far.
customer_reviews.author: AIS

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate reading
customer_reviews.text: The needle seems to only have two positions: halfway (this means the tank is not empty) or empty. Nothing in between.
customer_reviews.author: William Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any griller.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to screw on the grill. Gauge works great. Let's you know just how much propane is in the tank. Money saver!
customer_reviews.author: Shai

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I no know how much gas I have in the tank
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey D. McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: "Plug and play"
customer_reviews.text: Put the gauge in-line and can now see how much gas is left in the tank. Literally took 30 seconds to install and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Richard L Moore

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on our Toy Haulers propane tanks and they were a great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Andrusak

customer_reviews.title: Won’t last outdoors
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these in December for a friend and me. We install them recently in after four months they stopped working
customer_reviews.author: my2cents

customer_reviews.title: Never worked.  Wouldn’t allow any propane through!
customer_reviews.text: Never worked. Wouldn’t allow propane to flow. Had to remove in order to light grill. Waited too long to return - threw it in the trash. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this guage!!
customer_reviews.text: Works really good! Tells my how much propane is in the tank. I should have bought 1 of these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Never run out!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read and install. No need to guess or lose a temporary strip.
customer_reviews.author: Byrnath

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a secret santa gift and the receiver was excited because the always had to keep a backup gas tank when grilling because it is hard to determine how full the tank is.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I have a propane fire pit. It is very awkward checking to see if the tank is full. Now all I have to do is open the valve and look at the gauge to see if it is time to refill the propane tank.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and read.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of these from 2 vendors. Both are giving accurate level indications, so far.
customer_reviews.author: grizfish

customer_reviews.title: No more excuses for running out of gas in the middle of cooking!
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate. Just need to make sure the connections are tight to avoid gas leakage. I have two of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate reading. Easy to thread.
customer_reviews.text: Threaded on very easily. I had an all day cookout the day after I received it so I put it through 3 tank changes. The readings are accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: no leaks after the whole summer season. Its great to be able to check the level, i recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great to now know how much fuel I have left.
customer_reviews.author: James G. Heidisch

customer_reviews.title: Awesome LP Tank Gauge
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I use it on the tank on my camper and camp in primitive areas, the glow in the dark indicator needle is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Armando Bengochea

customer_reviews.title: Bleed your line after adding this!
customer_reviews.text: Works but could not start generator until loosened fittings to bleed line.
customer_reviews.author: Hun

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Worthless piece of garbage, it went from full to empty in one minute.
customer_reviews.author: Yossy G.

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful. I don’t have to guess how much gas is left in a container.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It sticks.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work. It won't let the gas through so what good is it.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Used these valves on my trailer for the propane tanks.
customer_reviews.author: David Truax

customer_reviews.title: jwestyusa GASLAND Propane Tank Gauge
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to attach to propane tank it helps with know the gas level.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The gauge needle gets stuck at the max level and requires tapping by a solid object to reset.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Worked only for 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for 3 months now just shows full even when empty
customer_reviews.author: Robinf89

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I'd say it's good. Does exactly what it's supposed to. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: D. Gravelline

customer_reviews.title: Fore warned is fore armed, Your gas is going ...
customer_reviews.text: Fore warned is fore armed, Your gas is going to play the Murphy game and disappear when the refill stations are closed. Then it will be Cold showers, cold meals etc. I have one on each line so I can switch tanks when one gets low.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth N.

customer_reviews.title: Nope. Never again.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these. Worked the first two days then moisture got inside and we can no longer read the gauge at all on one. Same thing happened with the second although we can see it is permanently stuck on empty.
customer_reviews.author: Kaila Langevin

product_meta.title: GASLAND Propane Tank Gauge, ACME/QCC1/Type1 Propane Adapter Fittings with Gauge, LP Gas Leak Detector Gauge, Propane Gauge Grill Valve Connector for Propane Cylinder, RV Camper, BBQ Gas Grill, Heater
feature_bullets: 🎁【HIGH QUALITY, MORE SAFER】 Long lasting high quality material provides secure, air-tight connection between propane tank.

🎁【DURABLE, HELPFUL】The propane tank gauge level indicator is helpful to monitor the LP tanks, no more running out halfway through cooking. And it is nice to use when troubleshooting, if you have a poor flame, but this propane tank gauge is in the green, therefore your problem must be elsewhere if your tank has gas. It also can be used as a leak detector, just turn off all propane appliances, open and close the tank, then wait a while to see if the pressure goes down. If it does, you have leak.

🎁【CONVENIENT, EASY TO INSTALL】 No tools required, you can easily install the propane gas gauge with the plastic hand wheel. If you just don't want to carry big tank around, with this adapter no more carry of heavy and uncomfortable 20lb propane tank for outdoor cooking.
🎁【MULTIFUNCTION, BEST SOLUTION】 This propane tank gauge is compatible with QCC1/Type1 connection and can be worked with propane regulator hose and propane adapter.
🎁【Excellent Customer Service】We have professional team to offer you excellent service. If you have any question, please feel free to contact us from Monday to Firday.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars285 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
